elements.title: a professional wrestling promotion in France (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 1924 Gold Medal Olympian Henri Deglane (pictured) co-founded a professional wrestling promotion in France which featured catch wrestling?

elements.title: Neptune (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Alexander McQueen collection Neptune drew negative reviews comparing the clothing to 1980s science fiction, Xena, and Wonder Woman?

elements.title: massive plastics fire in Indiana (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that three years prior to this month's massive plastics fire in Indiana, a court determined that the site was a fire hazard "unsafe to people and property"?

elements.title: Trimarjono (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that former East Java provincial secretary Trimarjono was known for his habit of standing in front of the governor's office lobby every morning?

elements.title: Lundie Kirk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 12th-century Lundie Kirk was left as "a charred roofless shell" after a fire in November 2022?

elements.title: Sophie Whitehouse (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that goalkeeper Sophie Whitehouse, who has lived in England, Africa and the US, has been chosen to play soccer for the Republic of Ireland?

elements.title: Battle of Nicopolis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the Battle of Nicopolis in 1798, Revolutionary French troops placed their artillery on top of an ancient burial mound?

elements.title: feathers do not oppose darkness (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while feathers are light, and light opposes darkness, feathers do not oppose darkness?
